valueFormat.notes: Main heading text for the empty state. Should be concise and describe what is missing. Keep to 3-7 words for best UX.
valueFormat.example:
'No campaigns found'
'Your inbox is empty'
'No results'

commonMistakes.mistake: Using generic 'No data' for all empty states
commonMistakes.why: Generic messages don't provide context about what's missing
commonMistakes.impact: Users don't understand what they're looking for or why it's empty
commonMistakes.fix: Use specific, contextual titles like 'No campaigns created yet' instead of 'No data'

valueFormat.notes: Supporting text that explains why the empty state exists and what users can do. Can include HTML if parseAsHtml=true. Should guide users to next action.
valueFormat.example:
'Create your first campaign to start engaging with customers'
'Try adjusting your filters or search terms'
'You haven\'t received any notifications yet'

valueFormat.notes: Controls whether to show the empty state icon. Default is true. Set to false for minimal empty states with only text.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show icon (default)
false // Text-only empty state

valueFormat.notes: Icon name from Insider icon system. Default is 'no-data'. Choose contextually appropriate icons (e.g., 'search' for no search results, 'inbox' for empty inbox).
valueFormat.example:
'no-data' // Default empty state icon
'search' // No search results
'inbox-empty' // Empty inbox
'folder-open' // No files

valueFormat.notes: When true, displays a call-to-action button below the description. Use with buttonText to provide primary action (e.g., 'Create Campaign', 'Add Item').
valueFormat.example:
true // Show action button
false // No button (default)

valueFormat.notes: Label for the action button (requires buttonStatus=true). Should be action-oriented and specific (e.g., 'Create Campaign' not 'Click here').
Additional props passed to the InButton component. Can include variant, size, loading, etc. Use to customize button appearance and behavior.
valueFormat.typescript: { variant?: string; size?: string; loading?: boolean; [key: string]: any; }

valueFormat.notes: Button variant type. Default is 'primary'. Common values: 'primary', 'secondary', 'tertiary', 'outline'.
valueFormat.example:
'primary' // Primary action (default)
'secondary' // Secondary action
'outline' // Outline button style

valueFormat.notes: Disables the action button. Use when action is temporarily unavailable (e.g., loading, insufficient permissions). Pair with buttonTooltip to explain why.
valueFormat.example:
true // Disable button
false // Enable button (default)

valueFormat.notes: Tooltip text shown on button hover. Especially useful when button is disabled to explain why (e.g., 'Insufficient permissions').
valueFormat.example:
'Insufficient permissions to create campaigns'
'Complete setup to enable this feature'

valueFormat.notes: Tooltip position relative to button. Default is 'top center'. Format: '{vertical} {horizontal}'.
When true, renders description as HTML instead of plain text. Allows links, formatting, etc. Always use with preventXss=true for user-generated content.
valueFormat.example:
true // Render HTML
false // Plain text (default)

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting parseAsHtml=true without preventXss=true for user content
commonMistakes.why: Opens XSS vulnerability if description contains user input
commonMistakes.impact: Security vulnerability - malicious scripts can execute
commonMistakes.fix: Always enable preventXss=true when parseAsHtml=true with user content

valueFormat.notes: When true, sanitizes HTML to prevent XSS attacks. MUST be true when parseAsHtml=true and description contains any user-generated content.
valueFormat.example:
true // Sanitize HTML (use with parseAsHtml)
false // No sanitization (default)

valueFormat.notes: CSS class for background color. Default is 'b-c-4' (background-color-4 from Insider DS). Use Insider color utility classes.
valueFormat.example:
'b-c-4' // Default light background
'b-c-white' // White background
'b-c-transparent' // Transparent

valueFormat.notes: CSS class for title text color. Default is 't-c-1' (text-color-1, darkest text). Use Insider text color utility classes.
CSS class for description text color. Default is 't-c-2' (text-color-2, secondary text). Use Insider text color utility classes.
valueFormat.example:
't-c-2' // Default (secondary text)
't-c-3' // Even lighter
't-c-muted' // Muted text

valueFormat.notes: CSS class(es) applied to icon container. Default is 'mb-3' (margin-bottom-3). Use Insider spacing utility classes.
valueFormat.example:
'mb-3' // Default spacing
'mb-4' // More space below icon
'mb-2 opacity-50' // Less space, semi-transparent

implementationPatterns.name: Conditional Empty States
implementationPatterns.description: Show different messages based on context (filters active, permissions, first-time user)
implementationPatterns.code:
<InNoData
  :title="getEmptyTitle()"
  :description="getEmptyDescription()"
  :buttonStatus="shouldShowAction()"
  :buttonText="getActionText()"
/>

const getEmptyTitle = () => {
  if (hasActiveFilters.value) return 'No matches found';
  if (isFirstTime.value) return 'Welcome! Get started';
  return 'No items yet';
};
implementationPatterns.when: Data can be empty for different reasons (filters, permissions, no data created). Each reason needs different messaging and actions.

implementationPatterns.name: Empty State with Quick Actions
implementationPatterns.description: Provide multiple action options in description via HTML links
implementationPatterns.code:
const quickActionsHtml = `

Get started by:

  • Using a template
  • Creating from scratch
  • Importing existing data
`;
implementationPatterns.when: Users have multiple ways to resolve empty state. Providing options reduces friction.

implementationPatterns.name: Progressive Empty States
implementationPatterns.description: Different empty states for first-time vs returning users
implementationPatterns.code:
<InNoData
  v-if="isFirstVisit"
  title="Welcome!"
  description="Let's create your first campaign"
  icon="sparkles"
  buttonText="Get Started"
/>

<InNoData
  v-else
  title="All caught up"
  description="You've completed all tasks"
  icon="check-circle"
  :buttonStatus="false"
/>
implementationPatterns.when: First-time users need onboarding, returning users need confirmation. Different messages for different user states.

useCases.title: Empty Data Table
useCases.description: Show when table/list has no items to display
useCases.example: Campaign list with no campaigns created yet. Show 'No campaigns found' with 'Create Campaign' button. Change message to 'No matches found' when filters are active.

useCases.title: Search No Results
useCases.description: Display when search query returns no results
useCases.example: User searches for 'widgets' but no results found. Show 'No results for "widgets"' with search tips and 'Clear Search' button.

useCases.title: Permission Denied State
useCases.description: Inform users they lack permission to view content
useCases.example: User without 'view reports' permission tries to access reports. Show 'Access Restricted' with explanation, no action button.

useCases.title: First-Time User Onboarding
useCases.description: Welcome new users and guide them to first action
useCases.example: New user's dashboard is empty. Show 'Welcome! Get Started' with encouraging description and prominent 'Create First Campaign' button.

bestPractices.title: Use Specific, Contextual Titles
bestPractices.description: Avoid generic 'No data' - describe what's specifically missing
bestPractices.code:
// Good:
title="No campaigns found"
title="No search results"
title="Your inbox is empty"

// Bad:
title="No data"
title="Empty"
bestPractices.reasoning: Specific titles help users understand what they're looking at and reduce confusion. Generic messages provide no context.

bestPractices.title: Provide Actionable Descriptions
bestPractices.description: Guide users on what to do next, don't just state the problem
bestPractices.reasoning: Users need guidance, not just problem statements. Tell them how to resolve the empty state.

bestPractices.title: Show Action Buttons Strategically
bestPractices.description: Only show action buttons when user can and should take action
bestPractices.reasoning: Don't show action buttons users can't use. It's frustrating. For permission issues, explain in description instead.

bestPractices.title: Always Sanitize User-Generated HTML
bestPractices.description: Use preventXss=true when parseAsHtml=true with any user input
bestPractices.reasoning: XSS vulnerabilities can compromise entire application. Always sanitize user-generated HTML content.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using same generic empty state everywhere
commonMistakes.impact: Users confused about what's missing and what to do
commonMistakes.fix: Create contextual empty states with specific titles and descriptions

commonMistakes.mistake: Enabling parseAsHtml without preventXss for user content
commonMistakes.impact: Malicious users can inject scripts and compromise security
commonMistakes.fix: Always use preventXss=true with parseAsHtml=true when content includes user input

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling filtered empty states differently
commonMistakes.why: Empty because of filters vs truly empty are different scenarios
commonMistakes.impact: Users don't know if they should create data or adjust filters
commonMistakes.fix: Check if filters are active and adjust message accordingly

commonMistakes.mistake: Showing action button when user lacks permission
commonMistakes.why: User clicks button but gets permission error
commonMistakes.fix: Hide button or disable it with tooltip explaining why

performanceNotes.description: HTML sanitization (preventXss) has performance cost for large content
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use parseAsHtml only when necessary. For simple text, use plain strings. Cache sanitized HTML if content doesn't change often.
performanceNotes.impact: Low: Only affects complex HTML descriptions

performanceNotes.description: Show empty state only when truly needed using v-if
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use v-if instead of v-show for empty states since they're shown rarely. Prevents rendering when data exists.
performanceNotes.impact: Low: Minor optimization for data-heavy pages

accessibilityNotes.description: Empty state should have proper heading hierarchy
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure title uses appropriate heading level (h2, h3) based on page structure. Don't skip heading levels.
accessibilityNotes.example: <InNoData title="No campaigns" /> should render as <h2> or <h3> depending on context

accessibilityNotes.description: Button text should be descriptive, not generic
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use specific button text like 'Create Campaign' instead of 'Click Here' or 'Get Started'
accessibilityNotes.example:
buttonText="Create Campaign" // Good
buttonText="Click Here" // Bad - not descriptive

accessibilityNotes.description: Empty state icon needs proper alt text for screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure icon has aria-label or is marked as decorative with aria-hidden='true' if purely visual

accessibilityNotes.description: When using parseAsHtml, ensure HTML is accessible
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Links in HTML descriptions need descriptive text. Avoid 'click here'. Lists should use proper <ul>/<ol> markup.
